parts: On a HTML webpage, how do I create a clickable "whastapp" icon that leads to opening whatsapp web on the user's desktop PC or user's laptop, with a new conversation directed to my handphone number? The icon should remain at a fixed location at the bottom right of the page at all time and does not move when the user scrolls up or down the page. It should look completely immobile.

**Creating a fixed WhatsApp icon**

The user wants to create a "WhatsApp" icon that's clickable and remains fixed at the bottom right of the page, opening WhatsApp Web with a new conversation directed to their number. I’ll assume the error in “whastapp” was just a typo.

To accomplish this, I’ll need HTML for a link and CSS to position the icon immovably at the bottom right. I’ll write up an example HTML and CSS snippet for this.

**Providing code and explanation**

The user needs a code example for a fixed WhatsApp icon that links to their phone number on WhatsApp Web. I’ll provide an HTML snippet with an anchor tag linking to a URL like `https://wa.me/YourPhoneNumber`, along with some CSS to fix the icon to the bottom-right corner of the page. The `target="_blank"` will open the link in a new window. I’ll also include the possible alternative URL for WhatsApp API links and suggest considering any responsive design challenges. Plus, I’ll address how WhatsApp Web works on desktops.

Below is an example that demonstrates how to create a fixed WhatsApp icon which, when clicked, opens WhatsApp Web with a new conversation directed to your phone number. Replace the placeholder phone number (with country code, no plus sign) and the icon image path with your actual details: ```html WhatsApp Fixed Icon Example ``` ### How It Works - **Fixed Positioning:** The CSS `position: fixed;` on the `#whatsapp-link` element ensures that the icon remains at the specified location (20px from the bottom and right) regardless of scrolling. - **WhatsApp Web URL:** The link `https://web.whatsapp.com/send?phone=1234567890` directs the user to WhatsApp Web with a new chat to the specified phone number. Make sure to replace `1234567890` with your own phone number in international format (omit any plus sign or spaces). - **Opening in a New Tab:** The attribute `target="_blank"` makes sure the WhatsApp Web opens in a new tab or window, preserving the current page. - **Accessibility:** The `alt` attribute on the `` tag ensures that screen readers can describe the icon appropriately. This approach is robust and works well on desktop browsers. If you plan to support mobile devices, consider that WhatsApp's API will typically open the WhatsApp app if installed, or revert to WhatsApp Web if not.

I would like the icon to be similar to the one on this page: https://www.helpling.com.sg/ , and upon hovering over it with the mouse, the icon is replaced with a bigger one, as per the behaviour on this site.

**Using web tool to analyze icon**

I need to use the web tool to examine the icon behavior on the Helpling website. The user asked for the icon to behave similarly, changing to a bigger one when hovering over it.

I'll go ahead and open the site with web.open_url to inspect the page.

After that, I'll analyze the icon's interaction and provide the information based on what I observe!

**Inspecting icon behavior**

I've been given instructions to use the web tool, so I need to open the website to confirm the details on the icon. The user wants a similar effect to what happens on the site, where the icon becomes bigger when hovered.

There's a small floating icon at the bottom-right, and I think it might be related to a contact feature—could be a phone icon or something else. I'll inspect it closely to confirm so I can guide the user with accurate information.

metadata.finished_text: Reasoned about WhatsApp icon behavior for 22 seconds

## Why Choose Helpling?

###  Minimalist   
Method Of Tidying 

Our housekeepers organise your home with category-based tidying and the principles of minimalism. 

###  200+ Hours   
Of Hotel Training 

All providers have completed 200+ hours of 5-Star hotel-grade training in bed-making, organization, and surface disinfection. 

###  50-Point   
Cleaning Checklist 

Our team cleans your home thoroughly with a rigorous 50-point cleaning checklist (living room, kitchen and bathroom). 

###  Personal Home   
Advisor 

Enjoy dedicated support 7 days a week, with a 15-minute response time via WhatsApp, email, or phone.

## FAQs

###   How does Helpling work?

We are an award-winning home services company that offers cite9†home cleaning  and other services such as cite28†elderly care , cite10†aircon servicing , cite32†plumbing , and cite23†handyman services  . You can make a booking for a one-off clean or schedule a regular cleaning via our mobile app/website. It takes just three easy steps to make your first booking. 

  1. Enter your address
  2. Make an appointment
  3. Pay securely online

###   What Home Services Does Helpling Offer?

Helping offers a wide range of services, including cite9†cleaning services , cite28†elderly care , appliance repair, cite23†handyman services , cite32†plumbing , cite10†aircon servicing , and more.

###   Is There a Mobile App for Helpling?

Absolutely! Helpling offers a user-friendly mobile app for both iOS and Android. With our app, you can effortlessly book services, manage your appointments, and connect with your personal home advisor.

###   What Payment Methods Are Accepted?

We want to make it easy and convenient for you to pay for your cleaning, so we offer payment through credit cards and debit cards. We’re always looking for ways to improve our payment options, so stay tuned for any updates in the future.

###   How Secure Is My Information?

Helpling takes data security seriously. We don’t save payment details. All personal information is securely stored and processed in compliance with industry standards.

###   How Can I Contact Helpling?

You can reach us via email, phone, or WhatsApp from Monday to Sunday between 10:00 to 17:00. Our home advisors are always ready to assist you.

###   What If I Am Not Satisfied with the Service?

Customer satisfaction is our priority. If you are unsatisfied with the service provided, please contact our Home Advisors team, and we will promptly address your concerns. 

###   How Do I Update My Booking?

You can easily update your booking through our mobile app or website. If you need assistance, our customer service team is available to help.

## Why Choose Helpling?

###  Minimalist   
Method Of Tidying 

Our housekeepers organise your home with category-based tidying and the principles of minimalism. 

###  200+ Hours   
Of Hotel Training 

All providers have completed 200+ hours of 5-Star hotel-grade training in bed-making, organization, and surface disinfection. 

###  50-Point   
Cleaning Checklist 

Our team cleans your home thoroughly with a rigorous 50-point cleaning checklist (living room, kitchen and bathroom). 

###  Personal Home   
Advisor 

Enjoy dedicated support 7 days a week, with a 15-minute response time via WhatsApp, email, or phone. 

   Book now

### KonMari™ Trained Housekeepers

【131†Image】 

【132†Image】 

## FAQs

###   How does Helpling work?

We are an award-winning home services company that offers 【9†home cleaning】 and other services such as 【28†elderly care】, 【10†aircon servicing】, 【32†plumbing】, and 【23†handyman services】 . You can make a booking for a one-off clean or schedule a regular cleaning via our mobile app/website. It takes just three easy steps to make your first booking. 

  1. Enter your address
  2. Make an appointment
  3. Pay securely online

###   What Home Services Does Helpling Offer?

Helping offers a wide range of services, including 【9†cleaning services】, 【28†elderly care】, appliance repair, 【23†handyman services】, 【32†plumbing】, 【10†aircon servicing】, and more.

###   Is There a Mobile App for Helpling?

Absolutely! Helpling offers a user-friendly mobile app for both iOS and Android. With our app, you can effortlessly book services, manage your appointments, and connect with your personal home advisor.

###   What Payment Methods Are Accepted?

We want to make it easy and convenient for you to pay for your cleaning, so we offer payment through credit cards and debit cards. We’re always looking for ways to improve our payment options, so stay tuned for any updates in the future.

###   How Secure Is My Information?

Helpling takes data security seriously. We don’t save payment details. All personal information is securely stored and processed in compliance with industry standards.

###   How Can I Contact Helpling?

You can reach us via email, phone, or WhatsApp from Monday to Sunday between 10:00 to 17:00. Our home advisors are always ready to assist you.

###   What If I Am Not Satisfied with the Service?

Customer satisfaction is our priority. If you are unsatisfied with the service provided, please contact our Home Advisors team, and we will promptly address your concerns. 

###   How Do I Update My Booking?

You can easily update your booking through our mobile app or website. If you need assistance, our customer service team is available to help.

parts:
**Looking at WhatsApp icon behavior**

I need to check the WhatsApp icon on Helpling's page. In the footer, there's a "WhatsApp Us" link. I’m guessing it's either in the header or footer. The user mentioned wanting an icon that changes to a larger one on hover. I don’t see an immediate hover effect, but I’ll assume it’s just a swap of images when hovering. I'll set up an example using HTML and CSS, with two states: a default and a hover state.

**Creating the WhatsApp button**

I’ll write some code using the CSS `background-image` property to create a fixed WhatsApp button that swaps images when hovered. The main idea is to use a button with a small icon that becomes large on hover using two different image files.

I’ll also need to make sure the button stays fixed at the bottom-right corner, even when it grows. Using `transform: scale()` could help, but since the user asked for “replacing” the icon, I’ll stick to swapping the images. Let’s finalize this with the HTML and CSS.

**Deciding how to handle hover effect**

To swap to a bigger WhatsApp icon on hover, I could resize the image using `transform: scale(1.4)`. However, since the user mentioned wanting a different file for the bigger icon, a CSS background-image swap is simpler to achieve.

I’ll keep the container's size fixed to avoid layout issues but use two images — one small, one large — toggling their opacities for the hover effect. I’ll make sure the container stays anchored and doesn’t shift. I'll finalize the HTML and CSS solution.
